CatDescriptText: Mr. William E. Norwood, chef and dining room manager, Crawford Grill, 2141 Wylie Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 29, 1959, pg. A1. with question: Do you believe the state and city FEPC laws are helping Negroes to get jobs they never held before?" answer reads: "I can't speak from an authoritative source, but from what different friends and different people tell me, jobs are just as hard for Negroes to get now as they were before we had FEPC laws. Applicants get the answer, they will be called later.  But they are never called."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of William E. Norwood wearing light colored short sleeved shirt, standing in front of Crawford Grill No. 2, 2141 Wylie Avenue, Hill District
